author: TEDx Talks
description:
Born into a Sierra Leonean family that was separated for eight years, Ashley shares her journey to shed light on the lasting effects of child separation and the power of family. Ashley reveals the emotional, psychological, and social challenges that arise—and the resilience, hope, and courage that can emerge in its wake.
 
Ashley Viagbo is a Development Administrator at The Arc Prince George’s County, where she helps raise critical resources to support individuals with intellectual and developmental disabilities. Her passion for advocacy has led her to speak before the Montgomery County Council to help secure funding for local libraries and to champion legislation during her time as an intern in the Maryland General Assembly with Senator Guy Guzzone.

Alongside her professional work, Ashley is pursuing ministry training and serves in her church alongside her husband, using her gifts of storytelling and connection to inspire others in their faith. She is also passionate about engaging
title: How can we help children separated from their parents? | Ashley Viagbo | TEDxLargo
